title: Bicycle motion:tabular and analytical part - b

content.description: Ruth rode her bicycle on a straight trail. She recorded her velocity v(t) , in miles per hour, for selected values of t over the interval 0≤t≤2.4 , as shown in the table above, For 0<t≤2.4,v(t)>0 .
content.question: Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@441D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of the problem. Approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@441D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using a midpoint Riemann sum with three subintervals of equal length and values from the table.

frqParts.text: Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@441D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of the problem. Approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@441D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using a midpoint Riemann sum with three subintervals of equal length and values from the table.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
